 ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ 1.2 - TIME-BASED MEDIA
CAPTIONS (PRERECORDED)(LEVEL A)
On accessible websites...

Captions are provided for all prerecorded audio content in synchronized media,
except when the media is a media alternative for text and is clearly labeled as
such. 

These websites...

Provide alternatives for time-based media.

WHAT'S AN EXAMPLE?
 A captioned tutorial 

 A video clip shows how to tie a knot. The captions read, 

"(music) 

Using rope to tie knots was an important skill

for the likes of sailors, soldiers and woodsmen.." 

From Sample Transcript Formatting by Whit Anderson.

I still don't really understand
[https://www.w3.org/WAI/WCAG21/Understanding/captions-prerecorded.html#examples] 
Web Content Accessibility Guidelines 2.2, W3C World Wide Web Consortium
Recommendation 27 February 2020 (https://www.w3.org/TR/2020/WD-WCAG22-20200227/,
Latest version at https://www.w3.org/TR/WCAG22/)  * Subscribe
